attributes.action: make sure that every human being in Britain including the old and the young, the sick and the healthy have voting rights which can be exercised in general elections.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
In 10 years your children could be fighting in Afghanistan, or who knows where. 

In 10 years time, your elderly parent might have no right to hospital treatment. 

In 10 years time, it might really be too late for the planet due to global warming, or nuclear proliferation.

Who is supposed to be doing something about these things, and why aren't they?

1) The government
2) Because they don't need to in order to get your vote.

A simple change to the electoral system will ensure that the government listens to those who care about something other than money - the future. 

Give everybody the right to a vote, and if they can't exercise that vote themselves, give someone else the power to vote on their behalf.
